n early 2024, we had the privilege of assisting the United States African Development Foundation with its 2024 Global All-Staff Training Conference. This event involved organizing an international conference and providing translation and interpretation services to ensure an inclusive and engaging atmosphere.

Learn more about how we use translation in our work: https://loom.ly/BFLnbp
1:
We are thrilled to announce that our President and CEO, Travis Adkins, will serve as the Inaugural Keynote Speaker at the closing ceremony for the 2024 Charles B. Rangel International Affairs Summer Enrichment Program. 🌍
This 6-week program, jointly administered by the U.S. Department of State (State Dept GTM) and Howard University supports undergraduate students from diverse backgrounds who are interested in pursuing careers in international affairs. We look forward to engaging with this year’s Rangel Scholars and celebrating their successful completion at the upcoming event!
#InternationalAffairs #Development #Education #RangelScholars
2:
Cooperatives des Theiculteurs de Nshili-Kivu (COTHENK), a tea growers’ cooperative located in the Southern Province of Rwanda received a $244K USADF grant in 2019 to support its farmers to boost tea farming productivity and efficiency. 🌱
Since then, COTHENK has provided quarterly bonuses of about $40 to some of its member farmers and rehabilitated 261 hectares of tea plants. This has increased the daily yield of these 261 hectares by over 133%, from 9 tons per day at the beginning of the grant to 21 tons per day by its conclusion. 
Additionally, COTHENK allocated over $8,000 in Community Reinvestment Grants to five local cooperatives, creating more #pathwaystoprosperity and extending the grant’s impact to benefit the broader community! 📈🇷🇼
#USADFImpacts #Rwanda #Tea #Agriculture #Development
